text: We got a strange problem that seems to be related to the new CRM cardextension that we built for company in a new tab and tickets. Going to the company card selecting the custom tab and then going to a tickets click on a ticket shows a empty(white) page. It seems that we get an extra / in the link /ticket/[ticketnumber]//view/1 . If we go back to the company card and selects another tab (not custom) then it seems that we dont get this extra /

<@U9SDG59T7> i'm an admin in at least a dozen HubSpot client accounts. would I be enrolled in beta-CRM in all of them, or is there a quick way to see which ones i need to audit for private apps the soonest?
Enrolling in the beta is per portal
Hi Johan, how are you adding tickets extension on company record page? Is that via UI or you custom-built it using dev tools?

Carterâ€™s right. That said, can you tell me more about what do you mean by auditing for private apps? Did you mean you wanted to check which accounts are enrolled and which are not, or is there more to it?
If you're trying to see which portals are enrolled in the beta you'll see the CRM Development tab in the menu. just and fyi
I assume you're probably asking about something a little more complex
i need to figure out where any private apps are, in what portals. i'm not sure who's done what, at what point.
i can think of two i've built

thus auditing.... going through the portals to see if we built apps at some point. all of us at this agency have a couple dozen clients each, not all on HubSpot, and remembering off the top of your head gets unreliable
You can see all the private apps for each portal using this link: <https://app.HubSpot.com/private-apps/{portalid}>
